result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:32 AM Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christina M. Formaro in court.  Attorney David E. Celebre in court for Christina M. Formaro. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Attorney Celebre advises the Court that the matter is not resolved and is requesting a trial date. Ludwig hearing to be held at next hearing.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury selection scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:32 AM  State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant, Christina M. Formaro, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. Attorney Celebre is requesting an adjournment for reasons set forth on the record. State takes no position. Court adjourns.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return to sender.  Rotation letter returned in mail.

Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
